bboxes.raw_text:
Tie up rainy days with ribbons
to keep the children entranced
for hours. Just tuck away color
full ribbons of various widths;
keep a package of paper plates
on hand, and save gift wrapping
papers decorated with child
pleaser designs like planes, boats
or flowers. With these supplies
you can turn the youngsters into
pirates, fashion models or their
hearts desire within minutes.
Pirates, for instance, can stomp
the deck in boards of curling rib
bons, a black paper eye patch
and seaman's hat of decorated
paper adorned with skull and
crossbones. Junior fashion mod
els can parade in spring bonnets
made by covering paper plates
with spring gift papers and ty-
ing them on under the chin with
ribbon.


X X


According to The Lindsay
Company, the largest manufac-
turer of automatic soft water
equipment for the home, there
are five steps to natural love-
illness of hands and face. Battle

PRINCETON, M. ]. Mrs.
Jacqueline Kennedy, the widow of
the slain president, is the choice
of the American public as the
woman they admire most in the
world today.


This marks the second conse-
cutive year that Mrs. Kennedy
has won top honors in this an
nual Gallup Poll popularity con-
test. In 1861, Mrs. Kennedy
placed second on the list, be-
hind Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt.


Named next most often In to-
days survey, and making her
first appearance among the top
rankings, is Mrs. Lyndon B.
LADY Bird) Johnson, wife of the
new chief executive.

Queen Elizabeth received the
third greatest number of men
tons, having placed high on the
list of the top ten most admired
women since her coronation in
1852.


The top ten in 1868, ranked
by order of mentions:


MOST ADMIRED WOMEN


1868
l. Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy
2. Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson
8. Queen Elizabeth II
4. Sen. Margaret Chase Smith
S. Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower
6. Mrs. Clare Boothe Luce
7. Miss Helen Keller
8. Princess Grace
g. Nine. Ngo Diem Nhu
10. Miss Marian Anderson

nationally known Negro comedian

taurants to close temporarily.


Gregory had led similar sitins
on the preceding day. All res
taurants where demonstrators
appeared are owned by the Dobbs-
Toddle House chain.

only in fully softened water.
Remove odor and skin secretion
by using a pure soap that fathers
freely. Thoroughly rinse soap
residues from your skin. Use soft
water generously to flood away
soap film. And put nothing on
your skin that leaves irritating
residues- always treat it gently.


Dust and dirt in the air and
on the soles of your shoes con-
stantly menace your precious
carpeting that costs so much!
Surveys show that the average
six-room house collects 1O8
pounds of dirt a year. Much OF
it falls to the carpet. To keep
loose soil from being embedded
in your carpets, vacuum them
twice a week and daily in en-
trance ways and traffic areas.
Concentrate on one small area,
vacuum back and forth over 1t
several times and then move on
to another area. Your home Will
be brighter


The 10th centurys smallest
waist on a normal woman was
the l3-inch circumference of the
French actress, Mile Polaire who
lived from 1881 to 1899.

TEMPE Twenty Congolese
students have spent the Christ
mas holiday time in sessions at
Arizona State University. They
are on a six months tour of the
United States under the SPONSOR
ship of the agency for interna-
tional development.


The group studied American
Political Institutions at ASU and
will continue their tour to Cali
fornia.

The teenage America held its annual Christ
mas party the YN1CA last Saturday night.


Pearl Chidress Linda Boydns Janet Smith, Lille
ones Beverly Robert Subett Carol Chester
Wright Annette Smith, Aethea Chester Jeanne Sube
Garland Chester Griffin Mams Harriet Johnson and
Betty Miller.


Others Lynda Brown Pat Brown June Hamilton Jerry
Oliver Newman Anthony Wesson, Earl
Manns Shea Hill and Mary Perry

nationally known Negro comedian
